item.title: Final Report
item.description: Introduction My Google Summer of Code project was done under the Ste||ar Group organisation. The project was to bring the HPXIO library up to date with HPX and to build upon it. HPXIO is a library written using HPX for asynchronous and fast I/O. The goal is to provide an interface for several I/O operations in distributed and parallel systems. Work Done All of the work done is contained in the following pull request : click

item.title: Bonding
item.description: Community Bonding Period This period in the gsoc program is when you get to know the org admins, mentors and other fellow contributors. I had a few meetings with my mentors during this month. In this period I mostly got familiar with the HPX runtime and got an introduction to the HPC cluster used by HPX - ROSTAM.

item.title: Preparation
item.description: Why I chose to do GSoC GSoC is hosted every year by Google and is a very sought after program for anyone wanting to get into open source. It was my quriosity surrounding open source and will to have something to do during the summers which made me try for GSoC. Choosing the organisation Selecting the correct org can determine the success of your project, and also the chances of your proposal getting selected.
